title: Classic Buttermilk Pancakes
description: Fluffy, golden pancakes that melt in your mouth. Perfect for a lazy weekend breakfast.
ingredients_text:
2 [Egg]
1 cup [Milk]
1 cup all-purpose [Flour]
2 tbsp [Sugar]
2 tbsp [Butter]
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup buttermilk
instructions:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together dry ingredients
2. In another bowl, beat eggs and add milk, buttermilk, and melted butter
3. Combine wet and dry ingredients, mixing until just combined
4. Heat a non-stick griddle or pan
5. Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake
6. Cook until bubbles form, then flip and cook other side

title: Rich Chocolate Layer Cake
description: A decadent chocolate cake with smooth, creamy frosting. Perfect for special occasions.
ingredients_text:
3 [Egg]
1 1/2 cups [Milk]
2 cups all-purpose [Flour]
2 cups [Sugar]
3/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
1/2 cup [Butter]
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C)
2. Grease and flour two 9-inch cake pans
3. Sift together dry ingredients
4. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy
5. Add eggs one at a time, then vanilla
6. Alternately add dry ingredients and milk
7. Divide batter between pans
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes
9. Cool completely before frosting

title: Vegetable Frittata
description: A versatile, protein-packed egg dish that works for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
ingredients_text:
6 [Egg]
1/2 cup [Milk]
1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, spinach, onions)
1/2 cup grated cheese
2 tbsp [Butter]
Salt and pepper to taste
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)
2. Chop vegetables
3. Whisk eggs with milk, salt, and pepper
4. Melt butter in an oven-safe skillet
5. Sauté vegetables until soft
6. Pour egg mixture over vegetables
7. Sprinkle cheese on top
8. Cook on stovetop for 2-3 minutes
9. Transfer to oven and bake for 10-12 minutes
